intro: Turraea vogelii var. proceroides, commonly known as the African velvet tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody, spiny capsules containing seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
